item.title: Ticket #1444 (comment-functions.php logic for comments_popup_link) created
item.dc:creator: emmajane
item.description:
On line 101 the logic is:

if (0 == $number && 'closed' == $post->comment_status && 'closed' == $post->ping_status) {

Which says that comments and pings must be closed, and the number of posts must be zero to give a "comments off" notification. This doesn't make sense to me. I'd rather have it, "if the comments are set to 'closed'" then show "comments off."

if ((0 == $number && 'closed' == $post->comment_status)
'closed' == $post->ping_status) {

I'm not sure if this is a feature request, or a bug though.

thanks, emma

item.title: Ticket #1423 (Outgoing pingbacks broken) updated
item.dc:creator: anibalrojas
item.description:
I tested my 1.5.1.2 with ​http://redalt.com/External/pingomation.php and was ableto make trackbacks FROM my WP, but not TO it. The response was:

Error.

Fault code: -32700 : parse error. not well formed

POST /blog/xmlrpc.php HTTP/1.0 Host: www.valhallaproject.com Content-Type: text/xml User-Agent: The Incutio XML-RPC PHP Library -- RedAlt/Pingomation Content-length: 452

<?xml version="1.0"?> <methodCall> <methodName>pingback.ping</methodName> <params> <param><value><array><data>

<value><string>​http://redalt.com/pinged/http%3Awww.valhallaproject.com/blog/2005/02/23/hibernate-y-spring-primera-impresiones/trackback/</string></value> <value><string>​http://www.valhallaproject.com/blog/2005/02/23/hibernate-y-spring-primera-impresiones/trackback/</string></value>

</data></array></value></param> </params></methodCall>

Spammer, go home

item.title: Ticket #1443 ($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] trouble on Mac OS X Server) created
item.dc:creator: jrabbe
item.description: The remote address environment variable $_SERVERREMOTE_ADDR? returns the ip address of the server for Mac OS X Server, if this is the case, use $_SERVERHTTP_PC_REMOTE_ADDR? instead.

item.title: Ticket #1442 (Patch for applying "posts_join" and "posts_where" to get_next_link() ...) created
item.dc:creator: pejve
item.description:
Patch for applying "posts_join" and "posts_where" to get_next_link() and get_previous_link().

Among other things this is nice for the Category Visibility plugin (which restricts access to certain posts from lower level users).

I hope you like it.

item.title: Ticket #1441 (foreach() warning if no post meta) closed
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
invalid:

Apologies, I was getting post meta confused with user meta. Ran upgrade.php and everything's finished.

item.title: Ticket #1441 (foreach() warning if no post meta) created
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
(latest svn)

If you haven't attached any custom fields to a post, you get a warning at the top of every screen: 

Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in /srv/htdocs/wp/wp-includes/functions.php on line 1172

Patch: 

--- functions.php       2005-06-14 13:16:26.887806504 +0100
+++ functions-mod.php   2005-06-14 13:23:04.870303968 +0100
@@ -1169,8 +1169,10 @@
                foreach ($users as $user) :
                        $metavalues = $wpdb->get_results("SELECT meta_key, meta_value FROM $wpdb->usermeta WHERE user_id = '$user->ID'");
-                       foreach ( $metavalues as $meta )
-                               $user->{$meta->meta_key} = $meta->meta_value;
+                       if ($metavalues) {
+                               foreach ( $metavalues as $meta )
+                                       $user->{$meta->meta_key} = $meta->meta_value;
+                       }
                        $cache_userdata[$user->ID] = $user;
                        $cache_userdata[$user->user_login] =& $cache_userdata[$user->ID];
                endforeach;

item.title: Ticket #1438 (Language element in wp-rss2.php is empty, making the feed invalid) created
item.dc:creator: stonecobra
item.description:
​http://feedvalidator.org/check.cgi?url=http://totalsync.com/blog/feed

While the language element is optional, when it does exist it helps to have a value. I noticed ticket number 862 ​http://trac.wordpress.org/ticket/862 talking about it, but it was marked as closed/fixed in version 1.5 in Feb 2005

This blog is using WordPress 1.5.1.2 (latest as of now), and the problem remains.

Please note that you do not have a version selector for 1.5.1.2
